result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc Ryan Lopit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
COURT:  16 CF 19 - 6 months county jail with huber credit held open to be provided to Clk of Courts office 4 days credit time served  - fine/costs $2000.00 given 30 days to pay or set up payment plan - DL revoked 27 months   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence -IID 27 months   On any vehicle owned or operated 45 days from today - OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations  
16 CF 114, 16 TR 220,  16 TR 221, 15 TR 650 and 16 TR 651 are dismissed and read-in

Defendant Marc R. Lopit in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Defendant Marc R. Lopit in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marissa James (victim) appears via phone.  State moved to amend count 2 in 16 CF 46 to straight DC.  Court grants motion to amend to DC w/o enhancer.  DE entered NC plea to 16 CF 46 and 16 CF 19.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty 16 CF 19 and 16 CF 46.  Victim addressed the Court.

COURT:  16 CF 19 - 6 months county jail with huber credit held open to be provided to Clk of Courts office  - fine/costs $2000.00 given 30 days to pay or set up payment plan - DL revoked 27 months   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence -IID 27 months   On any vehicle owned or operated 45 days from today - OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations  
16 CF 114, 16 TR 220,  16 TR 221, 15 TR 650 and 16 TR 651 are dismissed and read-in

Defendant Marc R. Lopit in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Defendant Marc R. Lopit in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE wishes to waive preliminary hearing.  Court advised him as to his right to have a prelim.  DE does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds DE has freely waived his right to a preliminary exam - finds probable cause and binds DE over for trail.
As per the request of Defense Attorney, Thomas W Duffy, the hearing set for June 23, 2016 has been removed from the Court's calendar.  mak
Letter from Diane McNamer

Combined with 16 CF 114, 16 CF 46 and 16 CF 19   Absolute sobriety - no contact with Marissa James.  Must provide a physical address where he will reside. Special Bail Bond Conditions for Operating while intoxicated
1.  Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages
2.  Defendant shall be subject to random testing of his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing.  Failure to report to the STOP program may result in the issuance of a warrant for the defendant's arrest, modification of bail, possible bail jumping charges and or forfeiture of bail.
